plentry.pd: 0: Original sound intensity, also known as dry signal, range [-20,10], unit: dB.
1: Early reflection signal intensity, also known as wet signal, range [-20,10], unit: dB.
2: Room size for desired reverb effect. Generally, the larger the room, the stronger the reverb. Range [0,100], unit: dB.
3: Initial delay length of the wet signal, range [0,200], unit: milliseconds.
4: Intensity of reverb persistence, range [0,100].
0: Dry signal level, i.e., the original sound intensity. Range [-20,10], unit: dB.
1: Wet signal level, i.e., early reflection signal strength. Range [-20,10], unit: dB.
2: Room size for the desired reverb effect. Generally, the larger the room, the stronger the reverb. Range [0,100], unit: dB.
3: Initial delay length of the wet signal. Range [0,200], unit: ms.
4: Intensity of the sustained reverb. Range [0,100].
0: Original sound intensity, also known as the dry signal. Value range: [-20,10], unit: dB.
1: Early reflection signal intensity, also known as the wet signal. Value range: [-20,10], unit: dB.
2: Room size for the desired reverb effect. Generally, the larger the room, the stronger the reverb. Value range: [0,100], unit: dB.
3: Initial delay length of the wet signal. Value range: [0,200], unit: milliseconds.
4: Reverb strength duration. Value range: [0,100].
0: Original sound intensity, also known as dry signal, range [-20,10], unit: dB.
1: Early reflection signal intensity, also known as wet signal, range [-20,10], unit: dB.
2: Room size for desired reverb effect. Generally, the larger the room, the stronger the reverb. Range [0,100], unit: dB.
3: Initial delay length of wet signal, range [0,200], unit: milliseconds.
4: Intensity of reverb duration, range [0,100].
